channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2907] Conan's Writing Staff As Bored As He Is [PIC]
item.description: Since he quit the Tonight Show, Conan O'Brien has been spending his days crafting some pretty clever tweets ...

item.title: [+2438] The guy in Room 11 has some explaining to do
[+2309] Cat's amazing mid-air bird catch!
item.description: Bird? Bat? Flying rat? Whatever, the efficiency of this feline's graceful leap is a wonder to behold.

item.title: [+1925] Frog Fail (gif)
item.description: Because failure is always an option.

item.title: [+1858] I Bought a CD, not a Licensing Agreement
item.description: A short and clever article on the hypocrisy of the music industry.

item.title: [+1652] Ten Things You Didn't Know About Super Mario Bros
item.description: Mario's reach might span generations, but did you know there's a reason behind why he wears overalls, a cap and a 'stache?

item.title: [+1255] Obama Caught Lip-Syncing Speech (video)
item.description: After Obama slips up during an address on health care, White House officials are forced to admit the president occasionally uses a backing track for important speeches.

item.title: [+955] Glenn Beck claims progressivism leads to Nazism. Oh really?
item.description: Glenn Beck's eliminiationist jihad against the progressive movement took an interesting rhetorical turn yesterday... Now, there's at least some reason to connect progressivism with Communism, since they are both left-wing phenomena and share at least some values. But Nazism? Let's look at some real American Nazis...

item.title: [+951] Best Google Trend Ever? [Pic]
[+866] d lecturer cam in nd lft coz ders nly 3 of us in d class
[+833] Faster, Pussycat! (pic)
item.description: Looks like warp drive is engaged - she's giving it all she's got!

item.title: [+790] The Apple Patents Cockpunching All Smart Phones
item.description: Here's an illustrated guide to the 20 iPhone patents that Apple's suing HTC over. They're kind of a doozy.

item.title: [+771] Zero Punctuation : Bioshock 2
item.description: This week, Zero Punctuation reviews Bioshock 2.

item.title: [+736] Scientists have discovered booze that won't cause a hangover
item.description: Booze, for all its magical wonder, still has big drawbacks: You can't sober up quickly, and you often get a hangover. Now Korean researchers have found a way of tweaking booze to limit the fallout — without cutting its strength.

item.title: [+646] In crib, no-one can hear you scream
[+646] Yahoo, that's one creative way to promote 2012
[+607] Flipping Off Cops Is Legal, Not Advised
item.description: Flipping the bird, or sticking out the middle finger, is perhaps the oldest insulting gesture on earth, dating to ancient Greece and adopted by the Romans as digitus impudicus – the impudent finger. A zillion middle fingers later, an Oregon man is suing suburban Portland cops over his use of the gesture, claiming civil rights violations...

item.title: [+600] Bottled Water fad dries as environmentalists wise up
item.description: Sales of bottled water have fallen for the first time in at least five years, assailed by wrathful environmentalists and budget-conscious consumers, who have realized that tap water is practically free.

item.title: [+593] Drug Gangs Taking Over U.S. Public Lands [InfoGraphic]
item.description: This infographic shows law enforcement statistics for outdoor marijuana cultivation

item.title: [+585] Funny or Die's Presidential Reunion
item.description: Barack Obama gets a surprise visit in the night from ex-Presidents Bush Sr. (Dana Carvey), Bush Jr. (Will Ferrell), Clinton (Darrell Hammond), Ford (Chevy Chase), Reagan (Jim Carrey) and Carter (Dan Aykroyd) to get a few pointers about the Consumer Financial Protection Agency. Directed by Ron Howard.
